post.date: Posted: Fri Jan 12, 2007 7:30 pmÂ Â Â Post subject:
post.author: 6th Venom
post.body:
Did not the artist said in the first link that he is baking all lights effects into the diffusemap, and the first "home" screenshot didn't contain any specular or bumpmaps?

So, it's very strange... they inverted the progress of game textures, i mean, the surfaces will not react to any dynamic lights?

It just look like megatextures on everything will be like old PS1 Wipeout game, it used 1 'big' tga by track, with all textures in it.

The only problem with megatextures, and especially light effect baked into it, is that you can't use it to make your own map, like you can in every previous games, except if the MAPeditor compile a .mega when it BSP the map, including lights effects into megatexture (diffuse).

post.date: Posted: Fri Jan 12, 2007 8:37 pmÂ Â Â Post subject:
post.author: goliathvt
post.body:
Those first shots were him setting up the scene in 3dsmax. The shots on page 10 are in-game. The in-game shots look just as good, in my opinion, but have slightly lower rez textures. The attention to detail, litter, etc. is outstanding and really sells every shot. While I appreciate the style, I'd love to see a little more vibrant splashes of color here and there.... then again, he may be saving that for later or maybe wants the washed out feel... it definitely adds to the delapidated atmosphere.

- Goliath
_________________
Staff

post.date: Posted: Sat Jan 13, 2007 12:23 amÂ Â Â Post subject:
post.author: Tron
post.body:
6th Venom wrote:
The only problem with megatextures, and especially light effect baked into it, is that you can't use it to make your own map, like you can in every previous games, except if the MAPeditor compile a .mega when it BSP the map, including lights effects into megatexture (diffuse).


At Quakecon it was said people will be able to download the base textures that are being used to generate the megatextures in Quake Wars, so if they don't go changing their plans on us we should be able to make them ourselves.

Now distributing...that's a whole other kettle of fish.

//<![CDATA[
var firstDate = 820454400000;
var lastDate = 1420070399999;
var wbPrefix = "/web/";
var wbCurrentUrl = "http:\/\/doom3world.org\/phpbb2\/viewtopic.php?t=18266";

var curYear = -1;
var curMonth = -1;
var yearCount = 18;
var firstYear = 1996;
var imgWidth = 475;
var yearImgWidth = 25;
var monthImgWidth = 2;
var trackerVal = "none";
var displayDay = "9";
var displayMonth = "May";
var displayYear = "2007";
var prettyMonths = ["Jan","Feb","Mar","Apr","May","Jun","Jul","Aug","Sep","Oct","Nov","Dec"];

function showTrackers(val) {
	if(val == trackerVal) {
		return;
	}
	if(val == "inline") {
		document.getElementById("displayYearEl").style.color = "#ec008c";
		document.getElementById("displayMonthEl").style.color = "#ec008c";
		document.getElementById("displayDayEl").style.color = "#ec008c";		
	} else {
		document.getElementById("displayYearEl").innerHTML = displayYear;
		document.getElementById("displayYearEl").style.color = "#ff0";
		document.getElementById("displayMonthEl").innerHTML = displayMonth;
		document.getElementById("displayMonthEl").style.color = "#ff0";
		document.getElementById("displayDayEl").innerHTML = displayDay;
		document.getElementById("displayDayEl").style.color = "#ff0";
	}
   document.getElementById("wbMouseTrackYearImg").style.display = val;
   document.getElementById("wbMouseTrackMonthImg").style.display = val;
   trackerVal = val;
}
function getElementX2(obj) {
	var thing = jQuery(obj);
	if((thing == undefined) 
			|| (typeof thing == "undefined") 
			|| (typeof thing.offset == "undefined")) {
		return getElementX(obj);
	}
	return Math.round(thing.offset().left);
}
function trackMouseMove(event,element) {

   var eventX = getEventX(event);
   var elementX = getElementX2(element);
   var xOff = eventX - elementX;
	if(xOff < 0) {
		xOff = 0;
	} else if(xOff > imgWidth) {
		xOff = imgWidth;
	}
   var monthOff = xOff % yearImgWidth;

   var year = Math.floor(xOff / yearImgWidth);
	var yearStart = year * yearImgWidth;
   var monthOfYear = Math.floor(monthOff / monthImgWidth);
   if(monthOfYear > 11) {
       monthOfYear = 11;
   }
   // 1 extra border pixel at the left edge of the year:
   var month = (year * 12) + monthOfYear;
   var day = 1;
	if(monthOff % 2 == 1) {
		day = 15;
	}
	var dateString = 
		zeroPad(year + firstYear) + 
		zeroPad(monthOfYear+1,2) +
		zeroPad(day,2) + "000000";

	var monthString = prettyMonths[monthOfYear];
	document.getElementById("displayYearEl").innerHTML = year + 1996;
	document.getElementById("displayMonthEl").innerHTML = monthString;
	// looks too jarring when it changes..
	//document.getElementById("displayDayEl").innerHTML = zeroPad(day,2);

	var url = wbPrefix + dateString + '/' +  wbCurrentUrl;
	document.getElementById('wm-graph-anchor').href = url;

   //document.getElementById("wmtbURL").value="evX("+eventX+") elX("+elementX+") xO("+xOff+") y("+year+") m("+month+") monthOff("+monthOff+") DS("+dateString+") Moy("+monthOfYear+") ms("+monthString+")";
   if(curYear != year) {
       var yrOff = year * yearImgWidth;
       document.getElementById("wbMouseTrackYearImg").style.left = yrOff + "px";
       curYear = year;
   }
   if(curMonth != month) {
       var mtOff = year + (month * monthImgWidth) + 1;
       document.getElementById("wbMouseTrackMonthImg").style.left = mtOff + "px";
       curMonth = month;
   }
}
//]]]] ><![CDATA[>

		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=167252&sid=91ec3c32c29990cc157be7d87da54055#167252"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Fri Jan 12, 2007 7:30 pm<span class="gen"> </span>   Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=167252&sid=91ec3c32c29990cc157be7d87da54055"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">Did not the artist said in the first link that he is baking all lights effects into the diffusemap, and the first "home" screenshot didn't contain any specular or bumpmaps?
<br/><br/>
So, it's very strange... they inverted the progress of game textures, i mean, the surfaces will not react to any dynamic lights?
<br/><br/>
It just look like megatextures on everything will be like old PS1 Wipeout game, it used 1 'big' tga by track, with all textures in it.
<br/><br/>
The only problem with megatextures, and especially light effect baked into it, is that you can't use it to make your own map, like you can in every previous   games, except if the MAPeditor compile a .mega when it BSP the map, including lights effects into megatexture (diffuse).</span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="row1" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?t=18266#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>

		<td class="row2" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=167260&sid=91ec3c32c29990cc157be7d87da54055#167260"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Fri Jan 12, 2007 8:37 pm<span class="gen"> </span>   Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=167260&sid=91ec3c32c29990cc157be7d87da54055"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">Those first shots were him setting up the scene in 3dsmax.  The shots on page 10 are in-game.  The in-game shots look just as good, in my opinion, but have slightly lower rez textures.  The attention to detail, litter, etc. is outstanding and really sells every shot.  While I appreciate the style, I'd love to see a little more vibrant splashes of color here and there.... then again, he may be saving that for later or maybe wants the washed out feel... it definitely adds to the delapidated atmosphere.
<br/><br/>
- Goliath<br/>_________________<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/" target="_blank" class="postlink"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/site/img/d3w.gif" border="0"/> Staff</a></span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="row2" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?t=18266#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>

			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody"/><table width="90%" cellspacing="1" cellpadding="3" border="0" align="center"><tr><td><span class="genmed"><b>6th Venom wrote:</b></span></td>	</tr><tr><td class="quote">The only problem with megatextures, and especially light effect baked into it, is that you can't use it to make your own map, like you can in every previous   games, except if the MAPeditor compile a .mega when it BSP the map, including lights effects into megatexture (diffuse).</td>	</tr></table><span class="postbody">
<br/><br/>
At Quakecon it was said people will be able to download the base textures that are being used to generate the megatextures in Quake Wars, so if they don't go changing their plans on us we should be able to make them ourselves.
<br/><br/>
Now distributing...that's a whole other kettle of fish.</span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
